answers.answer: there is probably nothing to be done for the 100% blocked carotid artery if your mother has no symptoms that could be coming from that artery.  you can't "unblock" it and any other surgery may be too risky for her.   at this time, she should control her cholesterol and diabetes (if she has it) and watch the right artery closely (every year).    she's probably surviving just fine with just one artery as they tend to interconnect in the brain.

question: My 80 year old Mother has dementia.    During her yearly physical the Dr noticed that her left carotid artery was notfunctioning properly.  He consulted with his Neurologist.  He then made an appointment for her to see her vascualrsurgeon who ordered an ultra sound done.  The ultra sound showed a blcokage in her left carotid as well as her right carotid artery.  That same day we had an emergency MRA done.  This morning I took her to her vascualr Dr and he read the results.  100% blockage in the left and 65% in right.  NO surgery needed he said.  WHY?  is my question.We are going to California on Tuesday for the winter months, should I get a second opinion?  This Dr is the Chief of Staff at the local hospital.  What should i do?Thank You!Mrs merl
title: cartid left artery
